{{Infobox comedian | name = Chris Distefano | image = | imagesize = | caption = Chris Distefano | pseudonym = | birth_name = Chris Distefano | birth_date = {{birth date and age |1984|8|26}} | birth_place = [[Brooklyn]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | medium = [[comedy]], [[film]], [[television personality]] | nationality = American | active = 2002-present | net_worth = | genre = | subject = | influences = | influenced = | spouse = | domesticpartner = | notable_work = ''[[MTV2's Guy Code|Guy Code]]''
''[[Girl Code]]''
''[[Guy Court]]'' | signature = | website = {{URL|chrisdcomedy.com|Official Website}} | footnotes = }} '''Chris Distefano''' (born August 26, 1984) is an American comedian. He stars in [[MTV]] and [[MTV2]]'s TV shows ''[[MTV2's Guy Code|Guy Code]]'' and ''[[Girl Code]]''. He also co-hosted Ultimate Beastmaster and the [[MSG (TV channel)|MSG]] TV show ''The Bracket''. ==Personal life== Distefano earned a bachelor's degree in psychology from [[St. Joseph's College (New York)|St. Joseph's College]] and a doctorate in physical therapy from [[New York Institute of Technology]].http://www.nyit.edu/images/uploads/2013/alumni/NYIT_Vol12No2_Digital_5-19.pdf{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} He previously dated comedian [[Carly Aquilino]]. The couple shared videos documenting moving in together on social media.http://www.mtv.com/news/2385964/girl-code-carly-aquilino-chris-distefano-sleeping/ ==Career== Distefano hosted the 2010 Fencing Masters on the SNY network & Elite 8 of the 2011 and 2012 March Madness Comedy Competition at the comedy club [[Carolines on Broadway]]. He was selected to headline Carolines' Breakout Artist Series and was selected as a finalist in the 2011 NY Comedy Festival. Distefano is a frequent guest on the [[Opie with Jim Norton]] show. Distefano headlined his first national U.S. tour in September 2015 with Monster Energy Outbreak Presents. He is currently one of two American announcers on Netflix's Ultimate Beastmaster for Season 2 that released on the streaming service December 15, 2017. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable" | Notes |- | 2011 | ''[[MTV2's Guy Code|Guy Code]]'' | Himself | Stars in guy code since season 2 |- | 2013 | ''[[Girl Code]]'' | Himself | |- | 2013 | ''[[Guy Code Honors]]'' | Himself | A 90-minute show that honors the superhero's & Villains from the 2013 [[San Diego Comic-Con International|Comic-Con]] in [[San Diego]], [[California]] |- | 2013 | ''[[Ain't That America (TV series)|Ain't That America]]'' | Himself | He co-hosts along with [[Lil Duval]] |- | 2013 | ''Charlemagne & Friends'' | Himself | [[MTV Video Music Awards 2013|VMA]] Pre-Party on [[MTV]] |- | 2013 | ''[[Guy Court]]'' | Himself | He is a Judge & was convicted for breaking Guy Code |- | 2013 | ''The Bracket'' | Himself | Co-hosts alongside [[Yannis Pappas]]. |- | 2014 | "Off The Bat From The MLB Fan Cave" | Himself |Co-hosts alongside [[Melanie Iglesias]] |- | 2015 |''[[Benders (TV series)|Benders]]'' |Anthony Pucello | |- | 2017 | ''[[Ultimate Beastmaster]]'' | Co-hosts Season 2 alongside [[Tiki Barber]] | |- |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Twitter}} *[http://www.comedycentral.com/comedians/chris-distefano Chris Distefano] on [[Comedy Central]] *[http://www.mtv.com/celebrity/chris-distefano/#cast=girl_code Chris Distefano] on [[MTV]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Distefano, Chris}} [[Category:American male comedians]] [[Category:American stand-up comedians]] [[Category:American television personalities]] [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Brooklyn]] [[Category:New York Institute of Technology alumni]] [[Category:Comedians from New York (state)]]
